docs.snippet: LEAD: BENJAMIN BRITTEN'S ''Albert Herring'' is a farce with serious undertones and the Juilliard American Opera Center, in staging it on Wednesday evening, properly bore down on the broad comedy but did not overlook subtler aspects of this 40-year...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: BENJAMIN BRITTEN'S ''Albert Herring'' is a farce with serious undertones and the Juilliard American Opera Center, in staging it on Wednesday evening, properly bore down on the broad comedy but did not overlook subtler aspects of this 40-year-old chamber opera. First staged at Glyndebourne in 1947 and given its American premiere at Tanglewood two years later, it was Britten's first attempt at comic opera and a surprisingly mature attempt at that.

headline.main: OPERA: 'ALBERT HERRING,' BY BRITTEN, AT JUILLIARD

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Speaking of animals, ''The Little Foxes'' is a sturdy mount that, with some whipping, has made it into the winner's circle in seasons past. But after almost a half century, it needs more of the whip than is applied at the Equity Library Theater. docs.snippet: LEAD: What's in a movie title? ''House'' (1986), for instance, conveys nothing, yet it's a perfect fit for the original, entertaining suspense yarn that will be shown on Sunday at 12:45 A.M., Wednesday at midnight and Saturday at 1:40 A.M. on HBO....
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: What's in a movie title? ''House'' (1986), for instance, conveys nothing, yet it's a perfect fit for the original, entertaining suspense yarn that will be shown on Sunday at 12:45 A.M., Wednesday at midnight and Saturday at 1:40 A.M. on HBO. This is a brisk thriller about a big Victorian dwelling that inflicts mayhem on its tenants.
